Job Posting: 177665 - Position: S26 Development, Summer 2026 - Vancouver (Co-op/Internship) - 4 Months 177665B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/30/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 01/26/2026 10:53 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country QuadReal Property Group Park Place 666 Burrard Street, Suite 800 Vancouver V6C 2X8 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2026 - Summer S26 Development, Summer 2026 - Vancouver (Co-op/Internship) - 4 Months 177665B Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 4 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Job ID: R0006412 About QuadReal Property Group 28.0 per hour for 0 Major List QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia. Its assets under management are $94 billion. From its foundation in Canada as a full-service real estate operating company, QuadReal has expanded its capabilities to invest in equity and debt in both the public and private markets. QuadReal invests directly, via programmatic partnerships and through operating platforms in which it holds an ownership interest. QuadReal seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come. QuadReal: Excellence lives here. www.quadreal.com We are committed to providing our Co-ops/Interns with a student experience that provides a supportive and engaging learning environment while developing skills and business acumen. Students will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of experiences including our Speaker Series, Fireside Chats, Volunteer opportunities and Networking events. Eligibility Note: To qualify for a student (Co-op/Internship) opportunity, students must be enrolled in their academic studies at a post-secondary institution (university/college) and must be returning to school after completion of their work term with QuadReal. If you are a student registered in an official co-op program at your post-secondary institution and completion of a final work term is a mandatory component for you to graduate, you are eligible to apply with the understanding that you will leave QuadReal at the end of your work term or have the possibility to be considered for full- time opportunities. Based in Vancouver, the Co-op/Intern, Development, will report to the Director of Development and support QuadReal's Investment Management and Development team in Western Canada. The in-house development team at QuadReal is committed to advancing its development program while being guided by a long-term vision, focused on thoughtful and responsible execution. We place a strong emphasis on collaboration and relationship-building, working respectfully, openly, and transparently with our key stakeholders, including community members, municipal staff, elected officials, and our consultant, contractor, and service provider partners. What We Offer: • Meaningful, hands-on experience supporting the real estate development of complex mixed-use assets • An organization and leaders committed to mentorship, learning, and professional growth • A Student Mentorship Program designed to provide support throughout your experience • Opportunities to build your industry knowledge through weekly Speaker Series & Fireside Chats • Opportunities to participate in case competitions within QuadReal during your work term, fostering cross-functional collaboration with intern peers and enhancing exposure to real-world problem-solving. • Giving back to the community with your peers and team members through volunteering events • Opportunities to build long-lasting industry and professional relationships What You Will Experience: • Assist the Director of Development in overseeing active mixed-use development projects across the Greater Vancouver Area, Okanagan, and Sea-to-Sky regions, with exposure from early concept through delivery and occupancy • Help support marketing and sales programs for residential and commercial strata and residential lease-up programs, including supporting QuadReal's Customer Care team during occupancy and resident move-in • Help support QuadReal's Construction team, including responding to RFIs, attending site meetings, and organizing site field reports • Create and maintain detailed financial models for development projects, including multi-family residential (rental and condominium), industrial, retail, and office property types • Conduct market research supporting feasibility analyses, market positioning, and tracking comparable development activity across product types • Assist with implementing and coordinating internal review processes at key project milestones, including reviews supporting capital approvals from the executive team • Investigate and analyze municipal planning and zoning policy to support development conceptualization, master planning, and design development • Prepare investment memorandums supporting the development process Prepare regular progress reports on development projects • The expected hourly rate for this role is $28. Job Requirements What You Will Bring: • Currently completing a university degree with a major in Real Estate, Planning, Finance, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics • Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with a high level of attention to detail and comfort working with complex data sets • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly communicate key themes and messages through both written and verbal communication • Ability to allocate time effectively and work under pressure to meet tight deadlines, manage multiple demands and competing priorities, and adapt to new ideas and change; comfortable following direction while also contributing to the direction • Advanced proficiency in Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word; proficiency with Bluebeam Revu is considered an asset. • Extremely proactive and able to work well in a collaborative environment, with the ability to take guidance and then move projects forward independently • Embrace and proactively support QuadReal's values and its culture of environmental sustainability and corporate and social responsibility Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions APPLICATION LINK: https://quadreal.wd10.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/QuadReal/job/Vancouver/Development--Summer-2026--- Vancouver--Co-op-Internship----4- Months_R0006412?source=LinkedIn?source=LinkedIn?source=LinkedIn?source=LinkedIn&workerSubType=98a5a70bf1981007a 9504c8bb03ab89d Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
